intro: Calyptronoma clementis subsp. orientensis, commonly known as the oriental calyptron, is a rare and delicate species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest undergrowth. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Due to habitat loss, it is considered threatened in the wild.
